column5: Why do you always keep your lunch there?
hijacked thread! lol
Yeah Tinman haha quick post more pics to breakjack
Will do tomorrow for sure! heading out on the rideau with the kids on my dad's boat.
Great day tomorrow so catch some big ones!
great report neat pics
Hey Guys! took the kids out fishing at the Manotik mill, always had luck there for the kids. My daughter is 5 and my son is 2.
Your little ones have infectious smiles!!  Well done sir.  cheers! HD
Cute Kids great that you get them fishing
Very cute pics!!!
Awesome....great report.... and pics..... PRICELESS  Thanks for sharing! Leechman
Looks like a real fun day! Is that the Watson's mill?
Crap. They catch bigger fish than I do.  I'm going out to buy one of those Snoopy rods, or is it Barby?  JF
Thats the Watson's mill! Close to home! And it was a tigger rod!!! It actually has a drag setting! lol
Drag is good. I can learn to use that.  JF
And it even comes with 50 lb test John for those really big ones!
My daughter had a dora the exploere rod and it had no drag, she caught a sunfish one day and a pike grabbed it pulled out a whack of line. i had to bring it in hand over fist! lol
Good. I like to horse 'em.  JF
Obviously she doesn't use braid.  JF
nope, no braid lol
So, just supposin' I got one of these rods, do ya think it would handle 35# Superbraid? It would be nice if the little holey thingy where the line falls out on the front had a ceramic liner.  JF
Yeah that's available on the paris hilton
Its great to smiles on the kids faces...Awesome pics!!
Hopefullt we will be out again on There Grampy's boat on monday to fish
this is one of my favorite reports all summer so far!  great pics, who doesnt love seeing kids faces when they catch fish!  cheers!
Hahahahahahahaha

Gotta thank you and the kids for inspiring me to finally catch a decent SMB today. As much as I covet that really cool purple spincaster, I doubt that the slab I had on today would have let hisself be hauled in on that. braid or no. I may still get a Dora rod for my everyday fishing, but for manly fish I guess I'll stick with my $19.95 Dick's Sports Shakespeare trigger spincaster and 4 1/2' rod with no backbone combo. If that doesn't pan out, I may have to spend more. Whatcha think?  JF
Nope I say spend the big bucks on a new Mickey Mouse Camera John haha
Does it need batteries?  JF
No batteries required and it doubles as a lunch pail
Will it fit down the bib of my waders?  JF
